data.title: Only display icons for navigation group of menus

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
re https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/27467

For commands in `navigation` group, right now we'll try to show icons first if they exist. If not, we display the command title. Our builtin explorer title only shows icons, so maybe we should only allow icons to be displayed as well. Allowing text being displayed sometimes looks weird.

![screen shot 2017-05-30 at 3 10 55 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/26607205/32ceb3fa-454a-11e7-8550-440f4142dafd.png)

data.title: Can't debug Docker recipe with inspector protocol

#27462

With inspector protocol, the debug adapter continuously restarts.

data.title: Confusing focus border on docs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (afe47dc84467b487ce0079ff72f55e7ef4f7ebca, 2017-05-30T10:34:18.253Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: none
---

Testing #27315

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open content assist
2. Expand docs
3. Move focus to docs (Ctrl + Alt + Space)
4. -> Three sides of the docs now show a blue border, that seems to indicate focus
5. PageUp/Down work on docs now
6. Close content assist while focus is on docs
7. Reopen content assist
8. -> Still three sides of the docs show a blue border
9. PageUp/Down go to the list, the border does not indicate focus
![screen shot 2017-05-30 at 2 52 35 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9205389/26606848/7f863094-4548-11e7-8feb-0b68514e5533.png)

Not sure if it should indicate focus. If so, it should do so consistently and maybe on all 4 sides.

data.title: group for menus is not intuitive
data.body:
re https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/27467

At the beginning I didn't know the meaning of groups for commands in title bar, so I didn't use them at all.

After adding 3 commands, I found them all in drop down list, which is not what I want. So I add icons for all commands, I still didn't see them take effect. After playing with it for a while, I thought group `navigation` really mean something.

Maybe we should put it clearly in documentation about the meaning of `groups` here.

with any new SetOptions call upon new output channel

data.title: Dragging folder from file explorer collapses the node
data.body:
#27346

Dragging an expanded entry will collapse it, but dragging a collapsed one doesn't expand it. I think it shouldn't collapse it if possible.

![may-30-2017 14-08-45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/26605096/8d8889dc-4541-11e7-8200-01a7d9a1c425.gif)

data.title: Output Channel Drop-down does not track active channel on startup- with PR fix
data.body:
Platforms Tested:
Insiders 5-30
Code 1.11.1 Stable

Windows 7
OS X Sierra
(should be all platforms)

Problem:
Output panel drop-down does not track current active output 
if output channel is activated later , typically when
an extension output Channel is active (eg Git). Output
select box will show the default 0 index output (Tasks)

Steps to reproduce:
- Open code with git repository/workspace
- select Git output Channel
- close code
- reopen code
- Git output will be active but drop-down shows Tasks

Fixed with PR #27645 
- always update active select box selection with setOptions call
  on any output channel update
- Tested on Windows 7, OS X

data.title: Fix some issues with dnd to the terminal
data.body:
- \, quote chars and space are now escaped.
- Paths from the file system are now properly passed through URI, causing \ to
  be pasted in correctly.

Fixes #27511

data.title: Fail gracefully when getChildren fail to provide a list
data.body:
re https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/27467

The promise I returned to `getChildren` invoker doesn't resolve or reject correctly and then the progress bar is always there and not indicating there is any error under the hood. It would be great users can distinguish that whether the fetching children is still in progress or just failed.

data.title: Task execution should have an option to show problems

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Linux version 4.10.11-1-ARCH (builduser@tobias) (gcc version 6.3.1 20170306 (GCC) )

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a task in json
```{
            "taskName": "Make Local",
            "command": "make",
            "args": ["-C", "${fileDirname}", "CONFIG_OPT=no", "-sj4", "local"],
            "isShellCommand": true,
            "showOutput": "silent",
            "isBuildCommand": true,
            "problemMatcher": {
                "owner": "cpp",
                "fileLocation": "absolute",
                "pattern": {
                    "regexp": "^(.*):(\\d+):(\\d+):\\s+(warning|error):\\s+(.*)$",
                    "file": 1,
                    "line": 2,
                    "column": 3,
                    "severity": 4,
                    "message": 5
                }
            }
        }```
1. There's no way to pop up the `Problem` tab when there are problems, only the `Output` tab unconditionally (which no longer has click-able filenames apparently?)

The `Problems` tab is quite useful, but the task definition should support a new property `showProblems` which opens the `Problems` tab if any problems are found in the output. Otherwise no change to the current behavior. `showProblems` should override `showOutput` in the case that there are detected problems.

data.title: Make it possible to disable the underlining and clickability of URLs in the editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

I'd like to be able to disable the clickability of URLs in the editor. This would mean they can't be followed via ctrl+click, nor would they be underlined or tokenized in a way that specifically identifies them as a URL.

Use case: I'm doing a lot of architectural design work and frequently write example URLs while figuring out the shape of data. The URLs are not resolvable, and are often invalid.

Example:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/298883/26602382/a5705202-45c6-11e7-96ca-27ad22a3bc40.png)

It appears that the mouse event comes in as a middle click which triggers paste selection in Linux. I haven't been able to get reliable steps for this but it's happened 3 times already today. In order to repro the active editor needs to have had a selection when you left the window.

data.title: Suggestion: Source Control Git: Add way to use the last commit message
data.body:
Suggestion:

Add way to use the last commit message as actual message of current commit. 
It's very useful when you have a standard commit message or if you need ammend latest commit.

- VSCode Version: 
```
Version 1.13.0-insider
Commit afe47dc84467b487ce0079ff72f55e7ef4f7ebca
Date 2017-05-30T10:39:45.742Z
Shell 1.6.6
Renderer 56.0.2924.87
Node 7.4.0

```
- OS Version: 
```
DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu
DISTRIB_RELEASE=17.04
DISTRIB_CODENAME=zesty
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Ubuntu 17.04"
NAME="Ubuntu"
VERSION="17.04 (Zesty Zapus)"
ID=ubuntu
ID_LIKE=debian
PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 17.04"
VERSION_ID="17.04"
```

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Change many files
2. Commit the first step with descriptive and standard organization message.
3. Change a lot of file
4. Go to Source Control panel, stage and...
_5. Suggestion to the Message input: Click on History icon and add the last message to the current commit message._
6. Commit the another part of implementation. 

Thanks...

data.title: Integrated terminal over-tabulates text
data.body:
When I start a new terminal, it tabulates the input WAY too right. The cursor, however, is placed right where it should be.
Seems like the text is tabulated, while the input is not.

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Creators Update x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a new integrated terminal
2. Profit =/

Couple screenshots:
https://files.gitter.im/Microsoft/vscode-go/yrzH/image.png
https://files.gitter.im/Microsoft/vscode-go/kEN5/image.png
https://files.gitter.im/Microsoft/vscode/FyeE/image.png
